newsitem.title: EGYPT: Israeli, PLO negotiators end Cairo peace talks.
newsitem.headline: Israeli, PLO negotiators end Cairo peace talks.

text.p: Israeli and Palestinian negotiators on Sunday ended their first meeting in more than two months aimed at reviving the stalled Middle East peace process.

Israeli delegate Yitzhak Molho told reporters at Cairo airport: "We had some constructive talks and probably there will be a continuation. That's all I can say." Palestinian officials were not immediately available to comment.

The delegations met in the Ittihadia presidential palace for more than three hours to lay the groundwork to restart the talks broken off in March after Israel began construction of a Jewish settlment in East Jerusalem.
Egyptian presidential adviser Osama el-Baz, who has mediated between the two sides, also attended the meeting.
